alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 28 at 3:18PM MST until September 28 at 5:15PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Eastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 515 PM MST. * At 318 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across northeast portions of the Tucson Metro Area. An automated rain gage near Houghton Road and Catalina Highway reported 1.10 inches of rain in the past 30 minutes. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tucson, Tanque Verde and Catalina Foothills. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
